featured.text: In the 1980s, proms were held in local churches for teenagers to attend.
There never seemed to be enough time to go to church, which disturbed some friends and relatives.
He was bothered by a small irritation every Sunday as he sang in the church choir.
Run by a team of church volunteers, the shop will collect any surplus, good-quality items and store them until they can be redistributed to the people who are needing those particular things.
The jewel of the architecture is the 22-domed Transfiguration Church, built in the early 1700s.

other.text: Unable to attend music school, she began her career as a singer for church gatherings.
The church was built with pine trees brought from the mainland, which was quite common for the 18th century.
The clouds parted and a _____ of light fell on the church, through the windows, and onto the floor.
Which of the following activities was NOT planned by the father for his children’s summer education? (A) Going to church.
She was born in Philadelphia and sang in church choirs during her childhood.

to help those who could not afford certain household items (B) to open a furniture store run by church volunteers (C) to teach people how to destroy disposable furniture (D) to sell good-quality furniture to disabled people 43.

definition.zh_def: 教堂，基督教的宗教場所，供信徒聚會和崇拜之用。
definition.en_def: A building used for public Christian worship.
definition.example: They went to church every Sunday to attend the service.
